alert.note: Alert for Butler; Cowley (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 06 at 2:26AM CDT until May 08 at 9:45AM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Kansas... Walnut River at Winfield affecting Butler and Cowley Counties. For the Walnut River...including El Dorado, Augusta, Winfield, Arkansas City...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Walnut River at Winfield. * WHEN...Until late Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 22.0 feet, A large portion of the fairgrounds flood along with rural roads about 3 miles northwest of Winfield that are near the river. Then one mile west of the city of Rock, expect 30th Road to be closed due to high water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:01 AM CDT Friday the stage was 20.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 21.5 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 am CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Mon Walnut River Winfield 18.0 20.4 Fri 2 am CDT 21.0 16.7 8.5 &&
info.instruction: Do not drive into flooded areas or go around barricades. Nearly two feet of water will carry most vehicles away. Turn around, don`t drown. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
